thread.title_full: UW-Madison won?t change ID cards to be voter ID compliant

title: UW-Madison won?t change ID cards to be voter ID compliant
text:
UW-Madison won’t change ID cards to be voter ID compliant 
Dane County clerk Scott McDonell said he doesn’t agree with the decision. 
“You’ll have 14,000-16,000 students who will have their driver’s license from either Minnesota, New York or Illinois. They will have their student ID, both perfectly legal, but they still won’t be able to vote unless they go get another ID from Union South,” McDonell said. 
UW officials said in a statement that they offer a separate ID for voting, but there are concerns with revising their regular student ID cards. 
“Adding the signature, as is required to be voter ID compliant, in combination with other information on the card increases the identity theft risk to students,” the statement said.
